title: fix(cron): share isolated announce flow + harden cron scheduling/delivery
body:
## Summary This branch consolidates cron isolated announce behavior with the shared subagent announce pipeline, while keeping cron-specific routing/session behavior intact. ### Main changes - Route **text-only cron isolated announce delivery** through `runSubagentAnnounceFlow` (shared announce logic). - Keep cron-specific direct outbound delivery for structured payloads (media/channelData). - Preserve cron-specific target resolution safeguards (`channel`/`to`/`accountId`/`threadId`, stale-thread protection, best-effort behavior). - Preserve heartbeat-only and duplicate-message suppression semantics. - Differentiate announce phrasing by context: - subagents: `subagent task` - cron: `cron job` - Includes cron scheduler/store hardening updates that are already part of this branch commit. ## Validation - `pnpm exec vitest run src/cron/` - `pnpm exec vitest run src/agents/subagent-announce` - `pnpm check` - `pnpm build && pnpm check` ## Potentially Superseded / Overlapping Work ### Open PRs likely overlapped by this branch - https://github.com/openclaw/openclaw/pull/10847 - https://github.com/openclaw/openclaw/pull/10809 - https://github.com/openclaw/openclaw/pull/10518 - https://github.com/openclaw/openclaw/pull/9687 - https://github.com/openclaw/openclaw/pull/11551 ### Related issues likely covered/partially covered by this branch - https://github.com/openclaw/openclaw/issues/11039 - https://github.com/openclaw/openclaw/issues/10119 - https://github.com/openclaw/openclaw/issues/8906 If maintainers agree this branch subsumes those paths, we can close the overlapping PRs/issues after merge.

Greptile Overview

Greptile Summary

This PR routes **text-only cron isolated-agent announce delivery** through the shared `runSubagentAnnounceFlow` pipeline (while keeping direct outbound delivery for structured payloads like media/channelData), and adds several scheduler hardening changes: safer cron next-run computation at boundaries, preservation of future `nextRunAtMs` on restart, state initialization guards, per-job wall-clock timeout, and exponential backoff via a new `consecutiveErrors` field (also added to the gateway schema). It also updates heartbeat prompting so `cron:` wake reasons relay queued cron system events instead of returning `HEARTBEAT_OK`. The main issues to address before merge are a committed debug-style test file that will be noisy/flaky in CI, and a timer-timeout implementation detail that can leak a scheduled timeout and trigger an unhandled rejection if `executeJobCore` throws synchronously.

Confidence Score: 3/5

- This PR is close, but has a couple of correctness/CI-stability issues to fix before merge. - Core refactor (routing cron announce via shared flow) and scheduler hardening look internally consistent, but the PR introduces (1) a committed debug-style test file that is likely to be noisy/flaky in CI, and (2) a timeout Promise.race pattern that can leak a scheduled timer and later reject unhandled if the primary promise throws synchronously. Fixing these should make the change set low-risk. - src/cron/debug-timing.test.ts, src/cron/service/timer.ts ## Additional Linking From Local Plan/Audit Pulled from: - `/Users/tyleryust/Development/openclaw/.worktrees/cron-mega-fix/.local/plan.md` -
